member.name: T:sl.ZEDCamera
member.summary: Main interface between Unity and the ZED SDK. Primarily consists of extern calls to the ZED SDK wrapper .dll and low-level logic to process data sent to/received from it.
member.remarks: The ZEDManager component creates a ZEDCamera instance in Awake() and handles all initialization. Most ZED functionality can be handled simply in Unity via ZEDManager or other high-level manager components (ZEDSpatialMappingManager, ZEDPlaneDetectionManager, etc.) Textures created by ZEDCamera by CreateTextureImageType() and CreateTextureMeasureType() are updated automatically by the wrapper whenever a new frame is available. They represent a specific kind of output, like left RGB image, or depth relative to the right sensor. As such, you never need more than one texture of each kind, since it can simply be reused by all scripts that need it. Therefore, textures created in ZEDCamera are indexed by their type (Image or Measure) and then by the options of each type. If a script needs a certain kind of output, ZEDCamera will make a new one if it doesn't exist, but refer to the existing one otherwise.

member.name: M:sl.ZEDCamera.RegisterTexture(Stride.Graphics.Texture,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Register a texture to the base

members.member:
Creates or retrieves a texture of type Image. Will be updated each frame automatically.
Image type textures are human-viewable, but have less accuracy than measure types.
Note that the new texture will exist on the GPU, so accessing from the CPU will result in an empty image. To get images with the CPU, use RetrieveImage() instead and specify CPU memory in the arguments.
What the image shows (left RGB image, right depth image, normal map, etc.) /// Resolution of the image. Should correspond to ZED's current resolution. Texture that will update each frame with the ZED SDK's output.

member.name: M:sl.ZEDCamera.RetrieveMeasure(sl.ZEDMat,sl.MEASURE,sl.ZEDMat.MEM,sl.Resolution)
member.summary: Retrieves a measure texture from the ZED SDK and loads it into a ZEDMat. Use this to get an individual texture from the last grabbed frame with measurements in every pixel - such as a depth map, confidence map, etc. Measure textures are not human-viewable but don't lose accuracy, unlike image textures.
member.remarks: If you want to access the texture via script, you'll usually want to specify CPU memory. Then you can use Marshal.Copy to move them into a new byte array, which you can load into a Texture. RetrieveMeasure() calls Camera::retrieveMeasure() in the C++ SDK. For more info, read: https://www.stereolabs.com/developers/documentation/API/v2.5.1/classsl_1_1Camera.html#af799d12342a7b884242fffdef5588a7f
member.param: ZEDMat to fill with the new texture.
Measure type (depth, confidence, xyz, etc.)
Whether the image should be on CPU or GPU memory.
Resolution of the texture.
member.returns: Error code indicating if the retrieval was successful, and why it wasn't otherwise.

member.name: M:sl.ZEDCamera.RetrieveImage(sl.ZEDMat,sl.VIEW,sl.ZEDMat.MEM,sl.Resolution)
member.summary: Retrieves an image texture from the ZED SDK and loads it into a ZEDMat. Use this to get an individual texture from the last grabbed frame in a human-viewable format. Image textures work for when you want the result to be visible, such as the direct RGB image from the camera, or a greyscale image of the depth. However it will lose accuracy if used to show measurements like depth or confidence, unlike measure textures.
member.remarks: If you want to access the texture via script, you'll usually want to specify CPU memory. Then you can use Marshal.Copy to move them into a new byte array, which you can load into a Texture. Note that you may need to change the color space and/or flip the image. RetrieveMeasure() calls Camera::retrieveMeasure() in the C++ SDK. For more info, read: https://www.stereolabs.com/developers/documentation/API/v2.5.1/classsl_1_1Camera.html#ac40f337ccc76cacd3412b93f7f4638e2
member.param: ZEDMat to fill with the new texture.
Image type (left RGB, right depth map, etc.)
Whether the image should be on CPU or GPU memory.
Resolution of the texture.
member.returns: Error code indicating if the retrieval was successful, and why it wasn't otherwise.

member.name: T:sl.DEPTH_MODE
member.summary: Lists available depth computation modes. Each mode offers better accuracy than the mode before it, but at a performance cost.
member.remarks: Mirrors DEPTH_MODE in the ZED C++ SDK. For more info, see: https://www.stereolabs.com/developers/documentation/API/v2.5.1/group__Depth__group.html#ga8d542017c9b012a19a15d46be9b7fa43

member.name: F:sl.DEPTH_MODE.NONE
member.summary: Does not compute any depth map. Only rectified stereo images will be available.

member.name: F:sl.DEPTH_MODE.PERFORMANCE
member.summary: Fastest mode for depth computation.

member.name: F:sl.DEPTH_MODE.QUALITY
member.summary: Balanced quality mode. Depth map is robust in most environment and requires medium compute power.

member.name: F:sl.DEPTH_MODE.ULTRA
member.summary: Native depth. Very accurate, but at a large performance cost.

member.summary: Displays a greyscale depth map.

member.name: F:sl.VIEW_MODE.VIEW_NORMALS
member.summary: Displays a normal map.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SUCCESS
member.summary: Operation was successful.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.FAILURE

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.NO_GPU_COMPATIBLE
member.summary: No GPU found, or CUDA capability of the device is not supported.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.NOT_ENOUGH_GPUMEM
member.summary: Not enough GPU memory for this depth mode. Try a different mode (such as PERFORMANCE).

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_NOT_DETECTED
member.summary: The ZED camera is not plugged in or detected.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SENSOR_NOT_DETECTED
member.summary: a ZED Mini is detected but the inertial sensor cannot be opened. (Never called for original ZED)

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_RESOLUTION
member.summary: For Nvidia Jetson X1 only - resolution not yet supported (USB3.0 bandwidth).

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.LOW_USB_BANDWIDTH
member.summary: USB communication issues. Occurs when the camera FPS cannot be reached, due to a lot of corrupted frames. Try changing the USB port.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CALIBRATION_FILE_NOT_AVAILABLE
member.summary: ZED calibration file is not found on the host machine. Use ZED Explorer or ZED Calibration to get one.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_CALIBRATION_FILE
member.summary: ZED calibration file is not valid. Try downloading the factory one or recalibrating using the ZED Calibration tool.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_SVO_FILE
member.summary: The provided SVO file is not valid.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SVO_RECORDING_ERROR
member.summary: An SVO recorder-related error occurred (such as not enough free storage or an invalid file path).

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SVO_UNSUPPORTED_COMPRESSION
member.summary: An SVO related error when NVIDIA based compression cannot be loaded

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_COORDINATE_SYSTEM
member.summary: The requested coordinate system is not available.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_FIRMWARE
member.summary: The firmware of the ZED is out of date. Update to the latest version.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_FUNCTION_PARAMETERS
member.summary: An invalid parameter has been set for the function.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.NOT_A_NEW_FRAME
member.summary: In grab() only, the current call return the same frame as last call. Not a new frame.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CUDA_ERROR
member.summary: In grab() only, a CUDA error has been detected in the process. Activate wrapperVerbose in ZEDManager.cs for more info.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_NOT_INITIALIZED
member.summary: In grab() only, ZED SDK is not initialized. Probably a missing call to sl::Camera::open.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.NVIDIA_DRIVER_OUT_OF_DATE
member.summary: Your NVIDIA driver is too old and not compatible with your current CUDA version.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_FUNCTION_CALL
member.summary: The function call is not valid in the current context. Could be a missing a call to sl::Camera::open.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CORRUPTED_SDK_INSTALLATION
member.summary: The SDK wasn't able to load its dependencies, the installer should be launched.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INCOMPATIBLE_SDK_VERSION
member.summary: The installed SDK is not the SDK used to compile the program.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_AREA_FILE
member.summary: The given area file does not exist. Check the file path.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INCOMPATIBLE_AREA_FILE
member.summary: The area file does not contain enough data to be used ,or the sl::DEPTH_MODE used during the creation of the area file is different from the one currently set.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_FAILED_TO_SETUP
member.summary: Camera failed to set up.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_DETECTION_ISSUE
member.summary: Your ZED cannot be opened. Try replugging it to another USB port or flipping the USB-C connector (if using ZED Mini).

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_ALREADY_IN_USE
member.summary: The Camera is already in use by another process.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.NO_GPU_DETECTED
member.summary: No GPU found or CUDA is unable to list it. Can be a driver/reboot issue.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.PLANE_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: Plane not found. Either no plane is detected in the scene, at the location or corresponding to the floor, or the floor plane doesn't match the prior given.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.AI_MODULE_NOT_AVAILABLE
member.summary: Missing or corrupted AI module ressources. Please reinstall the ZED SDK with the AI (object detection) module to fix this issue

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INCOMPATIBLE_CUDNN_VERSION
member.summary: The cuDNN library cannot be loaded, or is not compatible with this version of the ZED SDK

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.AI_INVALID_TIMESTAMP
member.summary: internal sdk timestamp is not valid

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.AI_UNKNOWN_ERROR
member.summary: an error occur while tracking objects

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.ERROR_CODE_LAST
member.summary: End of ERROR_CODE

member.name: T:sl.SENSING_MODE
member.summary: Lists available sensing modes - whether to produce the original depth map (STANDARD) or one with smoothing and other effects added to fill gaps and roughness (FILL).

member.name: F:sl.SENSING_MODE.STANDARD
member.summary: This mode outputs the standard ZED depth map that preserves edges and depth accuracy. However, there will be missing data where a depth measurement couldn't be taken, such as from a surface being occluded from one sensor but not the other. Better for: Obstacle detection, autonomous navigation, people detection, 3D reconstruction.

member.name: F:sl.SENSING_MODE.FILL
member.summary: This mode outputs a smooth and fully dense depth map. It doesn't have gaps in the data like STANDARD where depth can't be calculated directly, but the values it fills them with is less accurate than a real measurement. Better for: AR/VR, mixed-reality capture, image post-processing.

member.summary: Right RGBA unrectified image. As a ZEDMat, MAT_TYPE is set to sl::MAT_TYPE_8U_C4.

member.name: F:sl.VIEW.SIDE_BY_SIDE
member.summary: Left and right image. Will be double the width to hold both. As a ZEDMat, MAT_TYPE is set to MAT_8U_C4.

member.name: F:sl.VIEW.DEPTH
member.summary:
Normalized depth image. As a ZEDMat, MAT_TYPE is set to sl::MAT_TYPE_8U_C4.
Use an Image texture for viewing only. For measurements, use a Measure type instead (ZEDCamera.RetrieveMeasure()) to preserve accuracy.

member.name: F:sl.VIEW.CONFIDENCE
member.summary:
Normalized confidence image. As a ZEDMat, MAT_TYPE is set to MAT_8U_C4.
Use an Image texture for viewing only. For measurements, use a Measure type instead (ZEDCamera.RetrieveMeasure()) to preserve accuracy.

member.name: F:sl.VIEW.NORMALS
member.summary:
Color rendering of the normals. As a ZEDMat, MAT_TYPE is set to MAT_8U_C4.
Use an Image texture for viewing only. For measurements, use a Measure type instead (ZEDCamera.RetrieveMeasure()) to preserve accuracy.

member.name: F:sl.VIEW.DEPTH_RIGHT
member.summary:
Color rendering of the right depth mapped on right sensor. As a ZEDMat, MAT_TYPE is set to MAT_8U_C4.
Use an Image texture for viewing only. For measurements, use a Measure type instead (ZEDCamera.RetrieveMeasure()) to preserve accuracy.

member.name: F:sl.VIEW.NORMALS_RIGHT
member.summary:
Color rendering of the normals mapped on right sensor. As a ZEDMat, MAT_TYPE is set to MAT_8U_C4.
Use an Image texture for viewing only. For measurements, use a Measure type instead (ZEDCamera.RetrieveMeasure()) to preserve accuracy.

member.name: T:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS
member.summary: Lists available camera settings for the ZED camera (contrast, hue, saturation, gain, etc.)

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.BRIGHTNESS
member.summary: Brightness control. Value should be between 0 and 8.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.CONTRAST
member.summary: Contrast control. Value should be between 0 and 8.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.HUE
member.summary: Hue control. Value should be between 0 and 11.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.SATURATION
member.summary: Saturation control. Value should be between 0 and 8.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.SHARPNESS
member.summary: Sharpness control. Value should be between 0 and 8.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.GAMMA
member.summary: Gamma control. Value should be between 1 and 9

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.GAIN
member.summary: Gain control. Value should be between 0 and 100 for manual control. If ZED_EXPOSURE is set to -1 (automatic mode), then gain will be automatic as well.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.EXPOSURE
member.summary: Exposure control. Value can be between 0 and 100. Setting to -1 enables auto exposure and auto gain. Setting to 0 disables auto exposure but doesn't change the last applied automatic values. Setting to 1-100 disables auto mode and sets exposure to the chosen value.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.AEC_AGC
member.summary: Auto-exposure and auto gain. Setting this to true switches on both. Assigning a specifc value to GAIN or EXPOSURE will set this to 0.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.AEC_AGC_ROI
member.summary: ROI for auto exposure/gain. ROI defines the target where the AEC/AGC will be calculated Use overloaded function for this enum

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.WHITEBALANCE
member.summary: Color temperature control. Value should be between 2800 and 6500 with a step of 100.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.AUTO_WHITEBALANCE
member.summary: Defines if the white balance is in automatic mode or not.

member.name: F:sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.LED_STATUS
member.summary: front LED status (1==enable, 0 == disable)

member.summary: Path to a recorded SVO file to play, including filename.

member.summary: In SVO playback, this mode simulates a live camera and consequently skipped frames if the computation framerate is too slow.

member.summary: Define a unit for all metric values (depth, point clouds, tracking, meshes, etc.) Meters are recommended for Unity.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.coordinateSystem
member.summary: This defines the order and the direction of the axis of the coordinate system. LEFT_HANDED_Y_UP is recommended to match Unity's coordinates.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.depthMode
member.summary: Quality level of depth calculations. Higher settings improve accuracy but cost performance.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.depthMinimumDistance
member.summary: Minimum distance from the camera from which depth will be computed, in the defined coordinateUnit.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.depthMaximumDistance
member.summary: When estimating the depth, the SDK uses this upper limit to turn higher values into \ref TOO_FAR ones. The current maximum distance that can be computed in the defined \ref UNIT. Changing this value has no impact on performance and doesn't affect the positional tracking nor the spatial mapping. (Only the depth, point cloud, normals)

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.cameraImageFlip
member.summary: Defines if images are horizontally flipped.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.cameraDisableSelfCalib
member.summary: True to disable self-calibration and use the optional calibration parameters without optimizing them. False is recommended, so that calibration parameters can be optimized.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.sdkVerbose
member.summary: True for the SDK to provide text feedback.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.sdkGPUId
member.summary: ID of the graphics card on which the ZED's computations will be performed.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.sdkVerboseLogFile
member.summary: If set to verbose, the filename of the log file into which the SDK will store its text output.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.depthStabilization
member.summary: True to stabilize the depth map. Recommended.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.optionalSettingsPath
member.summary: Optional path for searching configuration (calibration) file SNxxxx.conf. (introduced in ZED SDK 2.6)

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.sensorsRequired

member.summary: Path to a recorded SVO file to play, including filename.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.portStream
member.summary: Path to a recorded SVO file to play, including filename.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.optionalOpencvCalibrationFile
member.summary: Set an optional file path where the SDK can find a file containing the calibration information of the camera computed by OpenCV. Using this will disable the factory calibration of the camera. Erroneous calibration values can lead to poor SDK modules accuracy.

member.name: F:sl.COORDINATE_SYSTEM.RIGHT_HANDED_Y_UP
member.summary: Right-Handed with Y pointing up and Z backward. Used in OpenGL.

member.name: F:sl.COORDINATE_SYSTEM.RIGHT_HANDED_Z_UP
member.summary: Right-Handed with Z pointing up and Y forward. Used in 3DSMax.

member.name: F:sl.COORDINATE_SYSTEM.LEFT_HANDED_Z_UP

member.name: T:sl.AREA_EXPORT_STATE
member.summary: Possible states of the ZED's spatial memory area export, for saving 3D features used by the tracking system to relocalize the camera. This is used when saving a mesh generated by spatial mapping when Save Mesh is enabled - a .area file is saved as well.

member.name: F:sl.AREA_EXPORT_STATE.AREA_EXPORT_STATE_SUCCESS
member.summary: Spatial memory file has been successfully created.

member.name: F:sl.AREA_EXPORT_STATE.AREA_EXPORT_STATE_RUNNING
member.summary: Spatial memory file is currently being written to.

member.name: F:sl.AREA_EXPORT_STATE.AREA_EXPORT_STATE_NOT_STARTED
member.summary: Spatial memory file export has not been called.

member.name: F:sl.AREA_EXPORT_STATE.AREA_EXPORT_STATE_FILE_EMPTY
member.summary: Spatial memory contains no data; the file is empty.

member.name: F:sl.AREA_EXPORT_STATE.AREA_EXPORT_STATE_FILE_ERROR
member.summary: Spatial memory file has not been written to because of a bad file name.

member.name: F:sl.AREA_EXPORT_STATE.AREA_EXPORT_STATE_SPATIAL_MEMORY_DISABLED
member.summary: Spatial memory has been disabled, so no file can be created.

member.name: T:sl.BatchParameters
member.summary: sets batch trajectory parameters The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. Parameters can be user adjusted.

member.name: F:sl.BatchParameters.enable
member.summary: Defines if the Batch option in the object detection module is enabled. Batch queueing system provides: - Deep-Learning based re-identification - Trajectory smoothing and filtering
member.remarks: To activate this option, enable must be set to true.

member.name: F:sl.BatchParameters.idRetentionTime
member.summary: Max retention time in seconds of a detected object. After this time, the same object will mostly have a different ID.

member.name: F:sl.BatchParameters.latency
member.summary: Trajectories will be output in batch with the desired latency in seconds. During this waiting time, re-identification of objects is done in the background. Specifying a short latency will limit the search (falling in timeout) for previously seen object IDs but will be closer to real time output. Specifying a long latency will reduce the change of timeout in Re-ID but increase difference with live output.

member.name: T:sl.dll_ObjectDetectionParameters
member.summary: Sets the object detection parameters.

member.name: F:sl.dll_ObjectDetectionParameters.imageSync
member.summary: Defines if the object detection is synchronized to the image or runs in a separate thread.

member.name: F:sl.dll_ObjectDetectionParameters.enableObjectTracking
member.summary: Defines if the object detection will track objects across multiple images, instead of an image-by-image basis.

member.name: F:sl.dll_ObjectDetectionParameters.enable2DMask
member.summary: Defines if the SDK will calculate 2D masks for each object. Requires more performance, so don't enable if you don't need these masks.

member.name: F:sl.dll_ObjectDetectionParameters.detectionModel
member.summary: Defines the AI model used for detection

member.name: F:sl.dll_ObjectDetectionParameters.enableBodyFitting
member.summary: Defines if the body fitting will be applied

member.name: F:sl.dll_ObjectDetectionParameters.maxRange
member.summary: Defines a upper depth range for detections. Defined in UNIT set at sl.Camera.Open. Default value is set to sl.Initparameters.depthMaximumDistance (can not be higher).

member.name: F:sl.dll_ObjectDetectionParameters.batchParameters
member.summary: Batching system parameters. Batching system(introduced in 3.5) performs short-term re-identification with deep learning and trajectories filtering. BatchParameters.enable need to be true to use this feature (by default disabled)

member.name: F:sl.dll_ObjectDetectionRuntimeParameters.detectionConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: The detection confidence threshold between 1 and 99. A confidence of 1 means a low threshold, more uncertain objects and 99 very few but very precise objects. Ex: If set to 80, then the SDK must be at least 80% sure that a given object exists before reporting it in the list of detected objects. If the scene contains a lot of objects, increasing the confidence can slightly speed up the process, since every object instance is tracked.

member.name: T:sl.ObjectDataSDK
member.summary: Object data structure directly from the SDK. Represents a single object detection. See DetectedObject for an abstracted version with helper functions that make this data easier to use in Unity.

members.member:
Image data. Note that Y in these values is relative from the top of the image, whereas the opposite is true in most related Unity functions. If using this raw value, subtract Y from the image height to get the height relative to the bottom.
0 ------- 1 | obj | 3-------- 2

member.name: T:ZEDCameraSettings
member.summary: Stores the camera settings (brightness/contrast, gain/exposure, etc.) and interfaces with the ZED when they need to be loaded or changed. Created by ZEDCamera and referenced by ZEDCameraSettingsEditor.
member.remarks: The actual settings themselves are stored in an instance of CameraSettings, for easier manipulation. But this class provides accessors for each value within it.

member.name: T:ZEDCameraSettings.CameraSettings
member.summary: Container for ZED camera settings, with constructors for easily creating default or specific values or making duplicate instances.

member.name: F:ZEDCameraSettings.CameraSettings.settings
member.summary: Holds an int for each setting, with indexes corresponding to sl.CAMERA_SETTINGS.

member.name: M:ZEDCameraSettings.CameraSettings.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. Call without arguments to set all values to default.
member.param: Camera's brightness setting.
Camera's contrast setting.
Camera's hue setting.
Camera's saturation setting.
Camera's sharpness setting.
Camera's gamma setting.
Camera's white balance setting. -1 means automatic.
Camera's gain setting. -1 means automatic.
Camera's exposure setting. -1 means automatic.

member.summary: Constructor. Sets settings to match another CameraSettings passed in the argument.
